alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Franklin; Lauderdale; Lawrence; Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 10:52PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Freezing Drizzle And Light Freezing Rain Expected Overnight... Light precipitation is expected to redevelop across the Tennessee Valley very late this evening and persist through the early morning hours on Friday. As temperatures continue to slowly fall below freezing, the precipitation will transition to a combination of freezing drizzle and light freezing rain. The potential for minor accumulations of ice will be greatest along and north of a line extending from Haleyville to Athens and Winchester, as these locations will experience the longest overlap of light precipitation and subfreezing temperatures. A thin glaze between 0.01-0.05 inches in depth will be possible on mainly elevated surfaces in this region. The risk for freezing drizzle and light freezing rain will diminish from southwest-to-northeast between 3-6 AM CST. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet, for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service in Huntsville.
